content.description: Short straight in thin crack that starts with hands and ends with tip locks in a groove.
content.location:
When you reach the apron leading up to Ivory Tower-Lord Caffeine area, head right a hundred feet or so and you will see this short straight-in thin crack.

N 37* 48.987'

W 119* 29.301'

El 8,471 ft

climbs.name: Tideline
climbs.fa: Dave Yerian, Tom Herbert, Merry McGrath

content.description: An outstanding finger/handcrack, one of the best of the grade in the Meadows. Lots of varied jams.
content.protection: Takes a range of gear from blue TCU to a #2 camalot. A #7 or 8 stopper is handy. 2-bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: In the main Olmstead area. Check Falkenstein's guidebook for more details.

content.description: Begin in the wide right-facing corner below the offwidth roof.  Lieback/undercling the roof (10d). Turn the corner to continue up the offwidth crack. Follow the crack to a series of steep slabs (10c) broken by two horizontal cracks.
content.protection: Double 5-7" gear for the OW. Singles from 1-3" for upper horizontals. Bolted anchor.
content.location: Look for the offwidth roof above a right-facing corner. Downhill and 50' right of Ivory Tower routes.

content.description: Climb an overhanging hand crack to a steep dihedral with a thin lieback/stem (crux) that protects with small wires.
content.protection: Regular rack to 3.5-inch. Natural anchors.
content.location: On the small tier of cliffs directly above Lord Caffeine and behind a stand of Mountain Junipers.

content.description: Dirty chimney (but the climbing is clean) leading to a constriction with jams.
content.protection: Regular rack
content.location: Up and to the left of "Enemy Within"

content.description: Unprotected face climbing near top.
content.protection: Pro to 2 inches
content.location: Starts with a 7 inch undercling to a hand crack.

content.description: Right-curving crack that goes from thin hands to fingers, with an exciting finish.  The anchor placements are very far back, about 25 ft back.
content.protection: Pro to 1.5", gear anchor.
content.location: Downscramble to climber's right, via obvious ledges visible from the topside belay.

content.description: The thin seam to the left of Short Change. Hooks on top
content.protection: Not much. Thin thin
content.location: Second tier of Olmstead Canyon Right. On the right side of the big flat area. A thin seam that splits a short wall. Gold to the right of the seam, black streaks on the left of the seam

content.description: A crack just left of Hot Box
content.protection: Pro to 2 inches.
content.location: Olmstead Canyon

climbs.name: Missle Toe
climbs.fa: Bruce Morris, Urmas and Becky Franosch 8/88

content.description: Climb the right-hand of the two cracks starting in the alcove up and right of the Ivory Tower formation. Crux involves wide fist jams. There's a miracle rest when it becomes possible to stem out and touch "the missle" with your toe.
content.protection: Standard rack with extra 3" and 3.5" cams.
content.location: This is the right-hand crack leading out of the same alcove as "Miss Apprehension" (5.10 hands).

climbs.name: Miss Apprehension
climbs.fa: Bruce Morris, Urmas and Becky Franosch 8/88

content.description: From a flat platform, scramble up a 5.6 start until you can launch into the overhanging hand crack crux (5.10a).
content.protection: Standard rack with a few extra in the 3-inch to 4-inch range.
content.location: Up in an alcove to the right of the Ivory Tower formation are two hand cracks that share the same bolted anchor. "Miss Apprehension" is the left-hand crack; "Missle Toe" (5.10a) is the right-hand crack with the 'missle'.

climbs.name: Lord Caffeine
climbs.fa: Urmas and Becky Franosch, Bruce Morris

content.description: A fine awkward and flaring right leaning crack climb. Depending on your strengths and weaknesses, you may find a different crux than your friends. I find all sections hard! Pants and long sleeves recommended.
content.protection: Cams, doubles from .3" to 1", single 2", 3" and 4".
content.location: Left end of the Tideline area in Olmstead. Look for the obvious right-leaning splitter in a section of black rock.

content.description:
Climb small dihedral through small roof straight up to black corner crack.

Continuous, slick climbing with decent finger locks.
content.protection:
Standard trad rack.

If the crack is clean, this might be easy to protect, but many slots seem to be plugged with dirt (amazingly, this did not detract from the climbing itself much)
content.location:
Just right of Age of Darkness (same start).

ST shows bolts for climb to right - these did not exist as of Aug. 2014.

Finish over dirty roof (R) and up to brushy ledge above.

content.description: Lieback crack.
content.protection: Pro to 2 inches.
content.location: Climbs a small leaning corner to the right of SHORT CHANGE at Olmstead point.

climbs.name: Live Wire
climbs.fa: Ken Ariza, Doe DeRoss, and Tom Herbert

content.description: Crux is near the top of the crack before face climbing leads to the top.
content.protection: Pro to 2 inches.
content.location: On a dark slab by itself, 150 feet right of Tideline.

content.description: A fun, easy offwidth that still requires you to actually use some OW technique. Low suffer quotient.
content.protection: A #6 camalot can be pushed up the first 20 ft. for those who don't want to run it out. Otherwise, some medium (#2-#4 camalot) pieces will suffice.
content.location: Left side of the Ivory Tower, between Lord Caffeine and Tideline.

climbs.name: Ivory Tower, Center
climbs.fa: Mike Hernandez, Bruce Morris, Stu Richie

content.description: Another fun crack climb, and a good warmup. Mostly a great handcrack with a thin hands section at the top.
content.protection: .5 camalot-3.5 camalot
content.location: The obvious handcrack on the Ivory Tower, between Lord Caffeine and Tideline.

content.description: Begins as a thin crack for about 20 feet. Where it peters out is the technical crux. The pumping crux comes in 1 1/4" crack leading to top.
content.location: On the right side of the same wall as "Grease Monkey" (5.9) are three parallel cracks: "Pressure Vessel" (5.10c), "Hot Box" (5.11d) and "Air-Cooled Unit" (5.11a). "Hot Box" is the center crack.

content.description:
Right leaning hand & fist crack.

Start in lower crack & move to upper crack when possible (about 10').

Pro is good until the crack peters out just below the ledge (5.9 move)

Traverse off ledge to tree (climber's left) to walk off.
content.protection:
Standard rack with extra 3-4".

3/4 - 1" gear needed for anchor at back of little ledge at the top (may need to excavate dirt to expose the crack)

Very well protected except top of crack 6 feet before ledge.
content.location:
After reaching slab on approach (after the pond & little forest) - turn left (about 10 o'clock) and head up to orange & black wall.

Climb is furthest left of this group (is 100 yards or more left of Lord Caffiene).

content.description: Thin 5.12a dihedral crack to a 5.12a tips finish off of a dike rail.
content.protection: Small to thin.
content.location: This is the thin crack system immediately right of the Cash Register crack (5.9)

content.description:
Great OW climbing on slightly grainy rock. The crux in my opinion is where the cheater flake on the right wall ends and the crack widens momentarily. Once you pull through this (stacking helps) the climbing is sustained but secure.

The finish is an easier wide squeeze.
content.protection:
If you want to sew it up, bring a 6 C4, 2 #5 C4s, and 2 #4 C4s.

Two bolt anchor.
content.location: This left facing corner can be seen from Ivory Tower Center. It is approximately 100 feet right of the Ivory Tower. To get off, you can walk climbers left about 40 feet to a rap station.

content.description: A straight in thin hands and fingers crack leading to a dirty mantel finish over a bulge ending on a small flat ledge.
content.protection: Regular rack. Emphasis on medium camming devices to thin wires.
content.location: "Easy Money" is a difficult finger to tips crack in the center of the small cliff band up and left of "Lord Caffeine" where "Re-Animator" (5.12a) and "Short Change" (5.10a) are also located.

content.description: Difficult face climbing out a roof.
content.protection: Pro to 2 inches
content.location: Out a small arch in Olmstead Canyon

content.description: Use jams, sidepulls, stems and jugs to reach the chains. Nice and pumpy, very fun jamming. Bolts have chains
content.protection: I used a mix of cams. It's pretty easy to see what you need from the base. Smallest I placed was a .3 c4, largest was a #2 c4.
content.location: Upper tier of Olmstead Canyon Right

content.description:
Head into the back of the chimney and up. The Reid guide gives this 5.7 R, but I think most will have a hard time finding any mandatory 5.7 moves. Fun addition to the olmsted offwidth circuit.

This also makes a great solo, due the the nature of the chimney you can never really fall all that far.

To descend walk left and rappel of the anchors for The Thrill Is Gone. If you went without rope keep walking left until you can walk down a gulley.
content.protection: Knee pads are nice, a few pieces from 0.25 to 1 inch.
content.location: The obvious large chimney as you're walking up the approach slabs.

content.description: Pull up onto a ledge.  Then up a right-facing flake.  Make cool transition moves to the upper straight in crack, and follow that up to anchor bolts on the first topside ledge (not required to do the trivial scramble up to top most ledge with huge tree).
content.protection: Pro to 4", bolted anchor with only one rap link.

content.description: Stunning thin crack leading to face moves.
content.protection: 2 draws, RP's and small offset cams. Nothing bigger than BD .2/.3 offset.
content.location: 100 yards to the right of Tideline.  Around corner.

content.description: Thin right-slanting tips crack to a hand rail traverse up and left to the top of the Ivory Tower
content.protection:
If you TR, use the Ivory Tower anchors.  A directional piece is useful at the start of the traverse left to mitigate rope swing while on TR.

Lead Pro.

Cams from .2" to 1'. Nuts, micro offsets and small to medium offset nuts.
content.location: Just to the right of the Ivory Tower Center crack

content.description: A 5.9 step across face move accesses the main crack which leads up to a step across left to a parallel crack where the 5.11a thin crux is located.
content.protection: Regular rack with an emphasis on medium sized camming devices
content.location: This is the steep thin crack on the black and white striped wall to the immediate right of "Hot Box"

climbs.name: Age of Darkness
climbs.fa: Dave Yerian and Merry McGrath, July 1985

content.description:
Obvious flared hands above a small roof.

Start down and right in small dihedral & climb through small roof to the left (5.8-9 ish) and the move left to under final roof.

Flared, bottoming crack through roof (crux) to ledge.
content.protection:
Standard rack.

At one foot wide ledge at top, look for 3/4 -1" gear at back (may need to move slightly to climber's left)
content.location:
Middle arrow on beta photo (see Grease Monkey).

Walk climber's left to tree & walk off left.
